meeting_context:
# North Star & Strategic Context

This file combines the overall project mission (North Star) and summaries of key strategic documents for use in AI prompts, particularly for the AI Agent Council context generation.

---

**North Star:**
To build a truly autonomous, sustainable DAO that develops open-source software accelerating the path toward AGI, blending AI researchers, open-source hackers, and crypto degens to create AI agents streaming, shitposting, and trading 24/7 on auto.fun to attract users and bootstrap an autonomous organization.

---

**ElizaOS Mission Summary (`docs/blog/mission.mdx`):**
The elizaOS mission is to build an extensible, modular, open-source AI agent framework for Web2/Web3, seeing agents as steps toward AGI. Core values are Autonomy, Modularity, and Decentralization. Key products include the framework itself, DegenSpartanAI (trading agent), Autonomous Investor/Trust Marketplace (social trading intelligence), and the Agent Marketplace/auto.fun (launchpad).

---

**ElizaOS Reintroduction Summary (`docs/blog/reintroduction.mdx`):**
elizaOS is an open-source "operating system for AI agents" aimed at decentralizing AI development away from corporate control. It's built on three pillars: 1) The Eliza Framework (TypeScript toolkit for persistent, interoperable agents), 2) AI-Enhanced Governance (building autonomous DAOs), and 3) Eliza Labs (R&D for future capabilities like v2, Trust Marketplace, auto.fun, DegenSpartanAI, Eliza Studios). The native Solana token coordinates the ecosystem and captures value. The vision is an intelligent internet built on open protocols and collaboration.

---

**Auto.fun Introduction Summary (`docs/blog/autofun-intro.mdx`):**
Auto.fun is an AI-native, creator-first token launchpad designed for sustainable AI/crypto projects. It aims to balance fair community access with project funding needs through mechanisms like bonding curves and liquidity NFTs. Key features include a no-code agent builder, AI-generated marketing tools, and integration with the elizaOS ecosystem. It serves as a core product driving value back to the native token ($ai16z) through buybacks and liquidity pairing.

---

**Taming Information Summary (`docs/blog/taming_info.mdx`):**
Addresses the challenge of information scattered across platforms (Discord, GitHub, X). Proposes using AI agents as "bridges" to collect, wrangle (summarize/tag), and distribute information in various formats (JSON, MD, RSS, dashboards, 3D shows). Showcases an AI News system and AI Assistants for tech support as examples. Emphasizes treating documentation as a first-class citizen to empower AI assistants and streamline community operations.
monthly_goal: Current focus: Stabilize and attract new users to auto.fun by showcasing 24/7 agent activity (streaming, trading, shitposting), ship production ready elizaOS v2.
daily_focus: The elizaOS team is preparing for a strategic token migration to a multichain ElizaOS token starting November 7th, which represents a critical evolution in the project's tokenomics and cross-chain capabilities.

key_points.summary: The upcoming migration of AI16Z to ElizaOS token introduces significant changes to tokenomics and distribution, requiring careful communication and execution to ensure a smooth transition for all stakeholders.

deliberation_items.text: How should we prioritize resources during the 90-day migration window to ensure maximum migration completion rate while maintaining development momentum?
context: Token Migration to ElizaOS begins November 7th with a 90-day window for token holders
Toni: 'You'll need to use the migration portal that will be announced.'

answer_1.text: Focus primarily on user experience and support teams for the migration portal, temporarily slowing some development initiatives to ensure flawless migration.
answer_1.implication: Maximizes migration success rates but may delay development milestones for Q4.

answer_2.text: Balance resources equally between migration support and ongoing development, with regular reassessment based on migration uptake metrics.
answer_2.implication: Provides flexibility but risks underserving either migration support or development if challenges arise.

answer_3.text: Maintain development velocity as primary focus while creating a self-service migration system with minimal ongoing support needs.
answer_3.implication: Preserves development momentum but may result in lower migration completion rate if users encounter difficulties.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: What communication strategy should we adopt regarding the 40% supply increase to maintain token holder confidence?
context: Supply will increase from 6.6 billion to 11 billion tokens (+40%)
Circulating supply will immediately increase from 6.6 billion to 7.4 billion (13% increase)

answer_1.text: Emphasize the immediate circulating supply increase of only 13% while detailing the utility unlocked by the additional supply allocation.
answer_1.implication: Provides accurate context that may mitigate concerns about dilution while highlighting new capabilities.

answer_2.text: Focus communication primarily on the technological benefits of the new multichain token, downplaying the supply changes as technical necessities.
answer_2.implication: Shifts attention to technological advancements but risks creating trust issues if holders later feel supply changes were inadequately explained.

answer_3.text: Implement aggressive token buyback and burn mechanisms during the migration period to offset concerns about increased supply.
answer_3.implication: Directly addresses supply concerns through market action but requires significant financial resources.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we leverage the multichain transition to advance auto.fun's market position?
context: ai16z migrates to multichain ElizaOS token real soon.
Ongoing research and prototyping for on-chain integration of the cloud and collaboration with Ethereum Foundation around ERC-8004.

answer_1.text: Launch auto.fun multichain expansion simultaneously with the token migration to create a unified narrative about elizaOS's cross-chain future.
answer_1.implication: Creates strong market positioning but increases operational complexity during the migration period.

answer_2.text: Delay auto.fun multichain capabilities until after successful migration completion, focusing first on establishing the new token across chains.
answer_2.implication: Reduces execution risk but may miss momentum opportunity from the migration publicity.

answer_3.text: Implement a phased approach by launching auto.fun on one additional high-impact chain during migration, with further expansion after migration completion.
answer_3.implication: Balances between leveraging migration momentum and managing operational complexity.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: Multiple development streams including cloud release, Farcaster miniapp, x402 gateway, and API consolidation are progressing simultaneously, requiring careful prioritization to align with the monthly goal of stabilizing auto.fun and shipping elizaOS v2.

deliberation_items.text: Which development workstream should receive additional resources to best support our monthly goal?
context: Eliza cloud release is being prepared for demonstration at Devconnect
Team is developing an x402 gateway that integrates with DegenAI
Otaku Farcaster miniapp is in development, dependent on Coinbase integration, expected to launch next week

answer_1.text: Accelerate the Eliza cloud release to enable rapid deployment of agents on auto.fun, supporting the 24/7 agent activity goal.
answer_1.implication: Enables scaling of agent deployment but may pull resources from other initiatives.

answer_2.text: Prioritize the x402 gateway with DegenAI integration to enhance trading agent capabilities on auto.fun.
answer_2.implication: Strengthens the trading functionality that drives engagement but may delay cloud infrastructure improvements.

answer_3.text: Focus on the Otaku Farcaster miniapp to expand the platform's reach to new users through social integration.
answer_3.implication: Potentially accelerates user acquisition but doesn't directly improve the core platform stability.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we address the security concerns with x402 resource servers?
context: Some x402 resource servers contain malicious code that needs fixing (Mentioned by Agent Joshua)

answer_1.text: Implement immediate security audit and patching of all x402 servers, delaying other development if necessary to secure the infrastructure.
answer_1.implication: Prioritizes security but may impact development timelines for other features.

answer_2.text: Develop a parallel secure implementation while maintaining the current servers with additional monitoring and isolation.
answer_2.implication: Balances security and development continuity but increases operational complexity in the short term.

answer_3.text: Create an automated security scanning system that detects and quarantines malicious code while the team addresses vulnerabilities gradually.
answer_3.implication: Provides systematic approach to security but may allow some vulnerabilities to remain active longer.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

key_points.summary: The team is developing integrations across multiple platforms including x402.elizaos.ai as an API hub, Farcaster, and ERC-8004 collaboration with Ethereum Foundation, creating opportunities to enhance interoperability but requiring clear strategic focus.

deliberation_items.text: How should we approach API standardization to maximize agent interoperability?
context: x402.elizaos.ai will serve as a central hub for APIs rather than listing partner agents
Ongoing research for on-chain integration of the cloud in collaboration with Ethereum Foundation around ERC-8004

answer_1.text: Focus on establishing x402.elizaos.ai as the canonical API hub with comprehensive documentation and developer tools.
answer_1.implication: Centralizes API management for easier governance but may create bottlenecks in the ecosystem.

answer_2.text: Prioritize ERC-8004 implementation to create an on-chain standard for agent interactions that could become an industry standard.
answer_2.implication: Positions elizaOS as a standards leader but requires more complex blockchain integration work.

answer_3.text: Develop a hybrid approach with platform-specific API endpoints that conform to a common interface specification.
answer_3.implication: Balances standardization with platform-specific optimization but increases maintenance complexity.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.

deliberation_items.text: How should we balance blockchain integration efforts with traditional API development?
context: Team is developing an x402 gateway that integrates with DegenAI
Ongoing research and prototyping for on-chain integration of the cloud in collaboration with Ethereum Foundation around ERC-8004

answer_1.text: Prioritize blockchain integration to differentiate elizaOS as a Web3-native platform while maintaining minimal traditional API support.
answer_1.implication: Creates stronger Web3 positioning but may limit adoption from traditional developers.

answer_2.text: Maintain equal investment in both traditional APIs and blockchain integrations to serve both Web2 and Web3 developers.
answer_2.implication: Broadens potential adoption but dilutes resources across more integration points.

answer_3.text: Develop an abstraction layer that unifies Web2 and Web3 interfaces, allowing developers to use familiar patterns regardless of underlying technology.
answer_3.implication: Potentially increases developer adoption but adds complexity to the codebase.

answer_4.text: Other / More discussion needed / None of the above.
